content: --मुखं (or आस्यं) that part of an act, wherein the subject of all the acts is intimated, is called अंकमुख, which suggests the {%germ%} as well as the {%end%}, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} in <ls>Māl. 1</ls> कामंदकी and अवलोकिता hint the parts to be played by भूरिवसु and others and give the arrangement of the plot in brief (यत्र स्यादंक एकस्मिन्नंकानां सूचनाखिला . तदंकमुखमित्याहुर्बीजार्थख्यापकं च तत् .. <ls>S. D. 312</ls>). The Daśarūpa defines it thus: अंकांतपात्रैरंकास्यं छिन्नांकस्यार्थसूचनात् . {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} where a character at the end of an act cuts short the story and introduces the beginning of another act; as in the second of <ls>Mv.</ls>
